title: Introduction
content: Looking at this image, I can see a commemorative plaque or marker with the title "ELBTUNNEL" at the top. This is clearly written in German. Let me examine the details:

title: Plaque Text Details
content:
The plaque contains German text with the following information:
- "ELBTUNNEL" (Elbe Tunnel)
- "BAUBEGINN INBETRIEBNAHME 22.7.1907"
- "BRUKOSTEN RD. 10 MILLIONEN GOLDMARK 9.1.1911"
- "EINBAU DER SICHERUNGSPLATTE 1983"
- "HÖHE VON DER SCHACHTSOHLE"
- "BIS ZUR EINFAHRT 23.50m"
- "LÄNGE DER TUNNELRÖHRE 426.50m"
- "WASSERHÖHE ÜBER DER SICHERUNGSPLATTE 12.00m"
- "4 AUFZÜGE JE TRAGKRAFT 130 PERS."

title: Elbe Tunnel Overview
content: This is clearly information about the Elbe Tunnel. The Elbe Tunnel (Elbtunnel) is a famous historic tunnel under the Elbe River in Hamburg, Germany. It was built in the early 1900s and connects the St. Pauli district with Steinwerder on the other side of the Elbe River.

title: Key Clues
content:
Key clues that confirm this:
1. The German language text
2. The specific name "ELBTUNNEL"
3. The construction dates (1907-1911) match the historic St. Pauli Elbe Tunnel in Hamburg
4. The technical specifications (426.50m length, 4 elevators with 130 person capacity each) match the historic Elbe Tunnel
5. The mention of "Sicherungsplatte" (safety plate) installed in 1983 matches renovations done to the historic tunnel

title: Visual Context and Location
content:
The background shows typical German/Northern European architecture with the mosaic tilework that's characteristic of the entrance buildings to the St.

Situated in Hamburg's vibrant St. Pauli neighborhood, this historic tunnel sits near the iconic Landungsbrücken. It's a significant landmark that showcases early 20th-century engineering, connecting two sides of the Elbe River and serving as a testament to Hamburg's innovative urban infrastructure.St. Pauli, Hamburg, Germany, Europe
